pr_title: BLUEBUTTON-1841 Create indexes for partdcontactnumber columns

timeline.bodyText: This is missing the update to provide ${logic.using-hash}
timeline.author: whytheplatypus

timeline.message:
Create the ability for flyway to use `using hash`

Some of the DBs that flyway works with don't allow for declairing a
method when creating indexes. This lets flyway work with both those DBs
and DBs like postgres where a indexing method can be specified. (in this
case `hash`.

timeline.bodyText: Did you consider a partial index (ie. an index with a where clause)? Looking at the shape of these columns, the data look's very sparse, with 0,N, and C being the most common values. Real contracts like H0023 only make a small ~10% of the data. If possible, using a partial index will make the index much smaller and perform much better.
timeline.author: RickHawesUSDS

timeline.bodyText: I like the idea of using a hash index.
timeline.author: RickHawesUSDS
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@
+
+create index ${logic.index-create-concurrently} "Beneficiaries_partd_contract_number_jan_id_idx"
+    on "Beneficiaries" ${logic.using-hash} ("partDContractNumberJanId");
+
+create index ${logic.index-create-concurrently} "Beneficiaries_partd_contract_number_feb_id_idx"
+    on "Beneficiaries" ${logic.using-hash} ("partDContractNumberFebId");
+
+create index ${logic.index-create-concurrently} "Beneficiaries_partd_contract_number_mar_id_idx"
+    on "Beneficiaries" ${logic.using-hash} ("partDContractNumberMarId");
+

timeline.message:
Create indexes with where clause to limit impact

Updates indexes on the beneficiaries table to be constructed with a
where clause. The clause limits the indexes to fields with a "valid"
value (a length of 5 characters).

The queries using these fields have also been updated with a `where
length = 5` clause in order to trigger using the index.

Correct construction of predicates in where clause

Where clause in part d beneficiary query was being overwritten rather
than combined.

timeline.bodyText: This name makes my head hurt. Could we just call it the postgresql-only-line?
timeline.author: karlmdavis

replies.bodyText: sure, although that's also confusing since there's no mention of postgres anywhere else.
replies.author: whytheplatypus

timeline.bodyText: Did you want to keep the partial index, even though the CONCURRENT likely covers the original concern?
timeline.author: karlmdavis

replies.bodyText: I'm not seeing an appreciable relative improvement in performance with the partial index, so I'll plan on removing in the interest of simplicity.
replies.author: whytheplatypus

timeline.author: karlmdavis

timeline.message: Use standard index for part d contract numbers

timeline.bodyText:
Sorry, one last thing: I'd add a header comment here that explains the reason for the change and references the JIRA ticket.
I wouldn't do that everywhere, but makes sense for DB migrations to me, as I often read them start - end, and I suspect other folks do, too. Good chance to help folks understand how & why the app has evolved over time.
timeline.author: karlmdavis

timeline.message: Include header information in the migration file
